wikipedia_page.main: Emily Grossman (born 7 July 1978) is a science communicator and populariser, was a resident expert on The Alan Titchmarsh Show, and has been a panellist on the Sky1 television show Duck Quacks Don't Echo. She has hosted events and given lectures at a number of institutions including the Royal Academy, the Royal Statistical Society, the Royal College of Physicians in Edinburgh, Scotland and various museums, both on science topics as well as advocating the encouragement of women in science. She has a PhD in cancer research, and contributed to the discovery of a new molecule while based at the Paterson Institute for Cancer Research.

response: * Emily Grossman, geneticist and science communicator
**Cell biology and genetics Dr Emily Grossman
